posts.name: Hamza Cheema
posts.cooked: I set up a VH109 radio last week successfully and its working with wifi and connecting me to the robot however I can’t access the settings with any of the ip links like 10.2.87.102/ or robot.local or connecting to the ethernet and trying it again. Above all of that when I try to redo the setup I get this error message after the configuration is successful and I attempt to check radio status.

posts.name: Max H.
posts.cooked: My teams radio is doing the same thing, hopefully someone has a solution

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Same thing for our team. I can ping the radio, and it’s responding. But I just can’t discover it or visit the configuration page.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked:
Hamza:

any of the ip links like 10.2.87.102/ or robot.local

The radio is located at 10.TE. AM .1 when configured for your team number, it can also always be accessed at 192.168.69.1 but you must statically configure your computer first to use that IP. In addition the radio can be reached at http://radio.local/ provided you have the latest firmware installed and mDNS setup on your laptop. Details here: https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home

Hamza:

Can you confirm you are connected to the VH-109 via ethernet and the SYS light is slowly blinking (the radio takes about 54 seconds to fully boot)

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: An additional note here: Our team has two VH-109 radios, and both were upgraded to the latest firmware. The one manufactured in 2025 works perfectly with the new firmware, while the one manufactured in 2024 seems to malfunction since the upgrade.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked: I suggest you reach out to support regarding the malfunctioning VH-109
